cards.flavorText: "Contrary to popular wisdom, I find it's best to fight fire with its opposite."
cards.name: Blue Elemental Blast
cards.originalText:
Choose one —
• Counter target red spell.
• Destroy target red permanent.

rulings.text: The decision to counter a spell or destroy a permanent is a decision made on announcement before the target is selected. If the spell is redirected, this mode can’t be changed, so only targets of the selected type are valid.

cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target red spell.
• Destroy target red permanent.

cards.flavorText: "I have a plan. Actually, I have three."
cards.name: Brainstorm
cards.originalText: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.

rulings.text: You draw three cards and put two cards back all while Brainstorm is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

cards.text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.

cards.name: Gifts Ungiven
cards.originalText: Search your library for up to four cards with different names and reveal them. Target opponent chooses two of those cards. Put the chosen cards into your graveyard and the rest into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You can choose to find fewer than four cards if you want. If you find one or two cards, your opponent must choose for them to be put into your graveyard, even if they don’t want to.

cards.text: Search your library for up to four cards with different names and reveal them. Target opponent chooses two of those cards. Put the chosen cards into your graveyard and the rest into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Jace Beleren
cards.originalText:
+2: Each player draws a card.
−1: Target player draws a card.
−10: Target player puts the top twenty cards of their library into their graveyard.

rulings.text: If there are fewer than twenty cards in the targeted player’s library, that player puts all the cards from their library into their graveyard.

cards.text:
[+2]: Each player draws a card.
[−1]: Target player draws a card.
[−10]: Target player puts the top twenty cards of their library into their graveyard.

cards.flavorText: "It's not just what you know. It's knowing where to find what you don't."
cards.name: Mystical Tutor
cards.originalText: Search your library for an instant or sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

rulings.text: The “shuffle and put the card on top” is a single action. If an effect causes the top card of the library to be face up, the second card down is not revealed.

cards.text: Search your library for an instant or sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

rulings.text: A “creature spell” is any spell with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact or enchantment. Older cards of type summon are also creature spells.

cards.flavorText: "Every thought is a string. You just have to find the right ones to pull."
cards.name: Threads of Disloyalty
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature with converted mana cost 2 or less
You control enchanted creature.

rulings.text: Threads of Disloyalty can’t target a creature with converted mana cost 3 or greater. If it somehow enchants a creature with converted mana cost 3 or greater, Threads of Disloyalty is put into the graveyard the next time state-based actions are checked.
Creatures on the battlefield treat {X} in their mana cost as 0 for the purposes of calculating converted mana costs.
Tokens usually have a converted mana cost of 0.

cards.text:
Enchant creature with converted mana cost 2 or less
You control enchanted creature.
